1.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
Bashan (often with the article), a region East of the Jordan
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
to crack in pieces, literally or figuratively
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

2.brief: to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a hook (as pointed); also a (large) shield (as if guarding by prickliness); also cold (as piercing)
the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity
a pot; also a thorn (as springing up rapidly); by implication, a hook
properly, fishery, i.e. a hook forfishing

3.brief: to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

to break away (from just authority), i.e. trespass, apostatize, quarrel

5.brief: to smoke, i.e. turn into fragrance by fire (especially as an act of worship)
properly, an extension of the hand, i.e. (by implication) avowal, or (usually) adoration; specifically, a choir of worshippers
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly (abstractly) spontaneity, or (adjectively) spontaneous; also (concretely) a spontaneous or (by inference, in plural) abundant gift

the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)

to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
